result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Alexzander Steel Threlkeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexzander Steel Threlkeld is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexzander Steel Threlkeld was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Alexzander Steel Threlkeld was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to sign up for Probation today June 6, 2016.
Defendant is entitled to credit from September 10, 2015 under 973.155.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and Deferred Judgment of Conviction.

 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 4

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF425.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF425.

-Follow recommendations of Evaluation.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with B.L.O.F.
-Restorative Justice Program if Victim requests.
-Maintain employment and/or school.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Comply with the terms of Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, unsupervised contact with juveniles, and B.L.F. unless later modified by a court order at the recommendation of her therapist.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Comply with terms of DJOC.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Alexzander Steel Threlkeld appeared from jail.  Case called at 2:34 pm. Court reviews file. Atty Gherty recites agreement.  No objection from ADA Kelly.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #1, #3 and #4. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court withholds entering conviction in Count one in favor of Diversion Agreement. Court signs agreement. Court finds Defendant Guilty of Counts #3 and #4. Court dismisses count #2. Parties make sentencing arguments. On Counts #3 and #4, court orders 3 yrs probation with conditions - Counts to run concurrent to each other
- 9 months condition time. Commencing today. Huber for work and treatment. Court will consider stay of jail time if housing is established.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  B.L.O.F. 12/27/00, E.M.F or any female juveniles under the age 18.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
